Hi all , I am facing a problem ! while upgrading my ubuntu to 12.04 LTS unfortunately shutdown the system and after that when i reboot my system  it shows black screen , i am not able to login to my ubuntu, the system freezes at seemingly random points and leaves me with only a cursor. please help me out  !
Did the shutdown occur in the middle of the upgrade?
yes , one of my friend just shut down , he was not aware that upgrade is going on :(
now the system   freezes at seemingly random points and leaves me with only a cursor
it would be wise to backup, format the Ubuntu partition and reinstall from scratch, the system might have been left in an unstable state with mixed packages from the old and the new version
its the worst case scenario ! its not possible to recover it !?

It would be difficult as you would need to examine the installation logs (I think they should be in /var/log/installer, don't remember the exact directory), then see which packages were upgraded and which ones were not, install the missing packages (paying attention to the dependencies)... There is a thing you could try though:
but how to do ? dint know the procedure !

edit /etc/apt/sources.list, edit all lines so that the distribution is "precise" and run "sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade" - it's extremely risky though and it's only a temporary solution.
Better to backup and reinstall from scratch.
how to backup ? elgaton
is it possible to get the terminal
otherwise its not possible to get backup my data !
Start the system from a live CD, then connect an external drive/USB key. Open a terminal and type "cd <path to old home dir on disk> && tar -pczf <path to external drive>/backup.tar.gz ."
That will backup ALL the contents in your home directory to a file named backup.tar.gz on your external drive.
You could try to type Ctrl+Alt+F1 to get the terminal, don't know if it will work though
its not coming ! i tried it
Then the system is definitely not working, the only solution is booting from a live CD and use the terminal from there.
